isis.stitle: PRE-DELIVERY/QUALITY INSPECTION INSTRUCTION MANUAL FOR 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 MODELS - 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 Model INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS (REPORT S00023) - AFTER ROAD TEST

svcproc.title: AFTER ROAD TEST

note.para: Position the vehicle on a level surface and perform the following operations.

item.para: Before the transmitter can be used for the first time, it has to be learned to the receiver. Up to 6 transmitters with different identification codes can be learned to a single RKE Pod.
The following steps must be used in order to "Learn" a transmitter to an RKE pod:
Turn key to ACC or ON position
On passenger pod with RKE; depress and hold the Window Up, Window Down, and Unlock buttons.
While hold the buttons down in step two depress and hold the Lock button for at least 5 seconds.
At the end of 5 seconds, the RKE pod will enter "Learn Transmitter" mode and stay there for exactly 10 seconds (the RKE pod buttons may be released).
During this 10 second period the Transmitter should be keyed at least twice.
The following steps shall be used in order to erase all "Learned" transmitters to an RKE pod:
Turn key to ACC or ON position.
On the driver pod; depress and hold the Window Up, Window Down, and Unlock buttons.
While holding the buttons down in step two depress and hold the Lock button for at least 5 seconds.
At the end of 5 seconds all learned transmitters will be erased from the passenger pod with RKE.

With key in the ON position (engine not running) press and hold the cruise control ON and RESUME switches simultaneously for at least 3 seconds. If no active engine faults are present, 111 will flash on the WARN ENGINE lamp. NO FAULT will appear on the odometer when no codes are present in the truck Electrical System Controller (ESC). Note any active fault codes and refer to the appropriate service manual for additional information.
Inspect visually for signs of exhaust leakage.
Visually inspect for any fluid leaks.

svcproc.para: 46. Air system drain valve(s) for proper operation.

item.para: Operate all air tank bleed valves, verify operation and shut off.

svcproc.para: 47. Wash vehicle, inspect for interior leaks, and remove plastic seat covers.
48. Verify that the proper vehicle certification label is affixed. Refer to the NEW VEHICLE PROCESSING MANUAL.
49. Add PDI location code and date to Vehicle Identification Decal.
50. Fill out and affix Pre-Delivery Service Identity Sticker CTS-1122 ( Figure 12) to the inside of the vehicle's windshield (optional).
51. Transfer all items marked under A, F, or R to the comments section on the first page. Include a brief explanation of each problem in the space provided.

para.emph: Do not use the "A" to indicate a required PDI adjustment has been made. For further explanation on when each inspection code should be used, refer to the General Information portion of this manual.
